description:
Added Sections
Added Vocals and Lyrics
Added swing rhythm to Pre Choruses and Choruses
More accurate BPM
Changed rhythm of the last measure
Guitar:
Moved parts to make it easier to follow
Tied some notes in the Intro Verse and added a chord at the end
Added HoPos to Main Riff
Added more Palm Mutes to Verses
Fixed some wrong notes in the Solo
Solo Whammy is 2 octaves up (tuned high e string an octave higher, DON'T TRY THIS AT HOME!)
Added noise
Bass:
Tied some notes in the Intro Verse
Changed Distortion Fuzz effect
Drums:
Improved some cymbals
Try to make the cowbells sound better
Added more ghost notes
Improved the Bridge
title: Killing in the Name

description: Cleaned up a few slides. Also, there's definitely something weird happening during the GP5 export - if nothing else, the volume levels drop on their own.
title: Killing in the Name

description:
Turns out GP5 doesn't support the whammy sound effect. Muted the real solo track and increased the volume on the alt track to sound closer to the album. 

That's weird about the tempo changes, since I didn't touch the tempo. Maybe something weird happened in the export to GP5?
title: Killing in the Name

description: Fixed all the tempo changes which for some reason were all moved a measure too early.

description:
Added strumming pattern to pre-chorus and chorus, slight corrections to pre-chorus.

Added whammy sound effect to solo. The solo is correct - I am a guitarist. :)

description:

description:
- tweaks to the bass and guitar parts
- changed bass to fingered
- added the main riff under the solo section
- rewrote the drum track
- fixed the BPM changes
- removed all the weird time signatures
- renamed the tracks
- added section names
- tidied up the track in general

This is an old tab I worked on a while ago and the drums are probably inferior to the current revision. I will update them asap but I'm submitting the rest of the tab in the meantime.
title: Killing in the Name
